intro: Euphrasia × reuteri var. substricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a hybrid plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in partial to full shade. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
